narrative: I wandered through a library where each book held a conversation we never had. Butterflies flew out of sentences and carried questions into glass jars of light.
The city folded like paper. Streetlamps became planets and a child's laughter echoed as tectonic plates. I felt both small and infinite.
A mirror asked me my favorite memory. When I answered, the mirror released a swarm of keys; each key unlocked a different voice.
